metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3714 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernels memory deduplication mechanism.Previous work has shown that memory deduplication can be attacked via alocal exploitation mechanism. The same technique can be used if an attackercan upload page sized files and detect the change in access time from anetworked service to determine if the page has been merged.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
